Status Epilepticus.scope: Management of convulsive status epilepticus (CSE) and non-convulsive status epilepticus (NCSE) in adults. Covers staged treatment protocol from emergent benzodiazepines through refractory and super-refractory phases.

definitions.definition: Seizure lasting >5 minutes OR ‚â•2 seizures without return to baseline between episodes
SE continuing after adequate doses of initial benzodiazepine AND one second-line ASM
SE continuing ‚â•24 hours after anesthetic initiation, including cases that recur during anesthetic weaning
New-Onset Refractory Status Epilepticus - RSE without clear acute/active structural, toxic, or metabolic cause in a patient without prior epilepsy
Febrile Infection-Related Epilepsy Syndrome - subset of NORSE with febrile illness ‚â•24 hours before SE onset

differential.features: Preserved awareness, asynchronous movements, eye closure, pelvic thrusting, prolonged duration with minimal post-ictal period
differential.tests: Video EEG, normal cEEG during event

differential.features: Brief (< 30 sec), occurs with LOC, myoclonic jerks possible
differential.tests: History of prodrome, rapid recovery, normal EEG

differential.features: Associated with fever/chills, rhythmic shaking, preserves awareness
Associated with structural brain injury, sustained posturing

notes: SE is a medical emergency with ~20% mortality; rapid treatment is critical
Every 5-minute delay in treatment associated with worse outcomes
cEEG monitoring essential - up to 48% of patients have non-convulsive seizures after convulsive SE controlled
Levetiracetam dosing: ESETT used 60 mg/kg; 40 mg/kg also acceptable per recent evidence
Ketamine timing: Earlier administration (in RSE, not just SRSE) correlates with better outcomes. Consider using early or in combination with midazolam
NORSE/FIRES: ~50% remain cryptogenic; start immunotherapy within 72 hours even without confirmed etiology. Ketogenic diet by Day 7
Propofol infusion syndrome: metabolic acidosis, rhabdomyolysis, cardiac failure - limit propofol to <48h at high doses
Always have airway equipment ready; many second-line and all third-line agents cause respiratory depression

evidence.recommendation: IM midazolam non-inferior to IV lorazepam
Second-line agents (LEV, VPA, fPHT) equivalent efficacy

evidence.source: [Rosati et al. CNS Drugs 2018](https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/30232735/); 2024 systematic reviews

evidence.recommendation: Ketogenic diet by Day 7 in NORSE

appendices.title: Time-Based Treatment Algorithm
appendices.content:
TIME 0-5 MIN: STABILIZATION + EMERGENT TREATMENT
‚Ä¢ ABCs: Airway, Breathing, Circulation
‚Ä¢ Glucose check ‚Üí Dextrose if low + Thiamine
‚Ä¢ IV access x 2
‚Ä¢ Lorazepam 0.1 mg/kg IV (max 4 mg) OR Midazolam 10 mg IM
‚Ä¢ May repeat BZD x1 in 5 min

TIME 5-20 MIN: URGENT/SECOND-LINE (if still seizing)
‚Ä¢ Choose ONE:
  - Levetiracetam 40-60 mg/kg IV (max 4500 mg)
  - Fosphenytoin 20 mg PE/kg IV at 150 mg PE/min
  - Valproate 40 mg/kg IV (max 3000 mg) - avoid in pregnancy
  - Lacosamide 400 mg IV
‚Ä¢ Start cEEG monitoring
‚Ä¢ CT head if not done

TIME 20-60 MIN: REFRACTORY SE (if still seizing)
‚Ä¢ Requires ICU and intubation
‚Ä¢ Initiate anesthetic infusion:
  - Midazolam: Load 0.2 mg/kg ‚Üí 0.1-2 mg/kg/hr
  - Propofol: Load 1-2 mg/kg ‚Üí 20-200 mcg/kg/min
  - Ketamine: Load 1-2 mg/kg ‚Üí 1-5 mg/kg/hr ‚Üê Consider EARLY
‚Ä¢ Target burst suppression on cEEG

TIME >24 HOURS ON ANESTHETICS: SUPER-REFRACTORY SE
‚Ä¢ Add additional ASMs (topiramate, perampanel)
‚Ä¢ Combine anesthetics (midazolam + ketamine)
‚Ä¢ If NORSE/FIRES ‚Üí See NORSE Protocol
‚Ä¢ Consider ketogenic diet
‚Ä¢ Goals of care discussion

appendices.title: NORSE/FIRES Immunotherapy Timeline
appendices.content:
DAY 0-3: FIRST-LINE IMMUNOTHERAPY
‚Ä¢ Methylprednisolone 1000 mg IV daily √ó 3-5 days
‚Ä¢ ¬± IVIG 0.4 g/kg/day √ó 5 days (can start simultaneously)
‚Ä¢ Continue ASMs and anesthetics as needed

DAY 3-7: ESCALATE IF NO RESPONSE
‚Ä¢ Add IVIG if not started
‚Ä¢ Consider PLEX (5-7 exchanges)
‚Ä¢ Do not wait for autoimmune results

DAY 7: KEY DECISION POINT
‚Ä¢ Initiate ketogenic diet
‚Ä¢ If first-line inadequate ‚Üí Start second-line:
  - Rituximab 375 mg/m¬≤ weekly √ó 4
  - OR Cyclophosphamide 750-1000 mg/m¬≤ monthly
‚Ä¢ Continue supportive care

DAY 7+: ONGOING MANAGEMENT
‚Ä¢ Continue second-line immunotherapy
‚Ä¢ Maintain ketogenic diet
‚Ä¢ Consider tocilizumab or anakinra if refractory
‚Ä¢ Goals of care discussion if no improvement

appendices.title: Rapid Protocol (3 AM Protocol)
appendices.content:
STEP 1: STABILIZATION (Time 0)
‚òê Call Neurology STAT; alert ICU
‚òê Position patient, protect head
‚òê Oxygen: Non-rebreather 15 L/min
‚òê IV access: Two large-bore IVs
‚òê Cardiac monitor
‚òê Fingerstick glucose ‚Üí Dextrose 50% 50mL + Thiamine 100mg if low/unknown

STEP 2: FIRST-LINE BENZODIAZEPINE (Time 0-5 min)
‚Ä¢ IV access: Lorazepam 4 mg IV push over 2 min
‚Ä¢ No IV: Midazolam 10 mg IM
‚Ä¢ No IV/IM: Midazolam 5 mg each nostril
‚Üí Wait 5 min. Still seizing? Repeat x1
‚Üí Wait 5 more min. Still seizing? GO TO STEP 3
üö´ DO NOT give a third dose of benzodiazepine

STEP 3: SECOND-LINE ASM (Time 5-20 min)
DEFAULT: Levetiracetam
‚Ä¢ 50 kg = 2500 mg IV over 10 min
‚Ä¢ 60 kg = 3000 mg IV
‚Ä¢ 70 kg = 3500 mg IV
‚Ä¢ 80 kg = 4000 mg IV
‚Ä¢ ‚â•90 kg = 4500 mg IV (max)

ALTERNATIVES:
‚Ä¢ Already on LEV at home ‚Üí Fosphenytoin 20 mg PE/kg IV
‚Ä¢ Pregnant ‚Üí Use Levetiracetam (avoid valproate)
‚Ä¢ Cardiac disease ‚Üí Use Levetiracetam (avoid fosphenytoin/lacosamide)

üö® Still seizing at 20 min? ‚Üí CALL ICU NOW, proceed to RSE protocol

Second-Line ASMs.rationale: Preferred - fewest drug interactions, no cardiac monitoring needed

Second-Line ASMs.target: Seizure cessation; therapeutic level not needed acutely

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).dosing: Load 0.2 mg/kg bolus; then 0.1 mg/kg/hr, titrate to burst suppression; max 2 mg/kg/hr
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).rationale: First-line anesthetic for RSE; less hypotension than propofol

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).rationale: NMDA antagonist - different mechanism; GIVE EARLY for better outcomes
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).timing: Consider early in RSE, not just SRSE; can combine with midazolam
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).target: Seizure cessation; may not need burst suppression
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).contraindications: Severe uncontrolled HTN; conditions where increased ICP is harmful

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).dosing: Load 1-2 mg/kg; then 20-200 mcg/kg/min; limit <48h at high dose

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).monitoring: PROPOFOL INFUSION SYNDROME: check triglycerides, lactate, CPK daily; limit duration

Refractory SE (Anesthetics).dosing: Ketamine load 1 mg/kg + Midazolam load 0.2 mg/kg; then dual infusions
Refractory SE (Anesthetics).rationale: 2024 data: combination may reduce SE duration faster than midazolam alone
